description: [deprecated] Create GitHub pull requests or GitHub issues using a `safety check` json report file. Being replaced by newer features.

options.name: --check-report
options.description: JSON output of Safety Check to work with.

options.name: --key
options.description: API Key for safetycli.com's vulnerability database. Can be set as SAFETY_API_KEY environment variable.

options.name: --policy-file
options.description: Define the policy file to be used

options.name: --stage
options.description: Assign a development lifecycle stage to your scan (default: development). This labels the scan and its findings in Safety Platform with this stage.

options.name: --proxy-host
options.description: Specify a proxy host for network communications. Note: proxy details can be set globally in a config file.

options.name: --proxy-port
options.description: Set the proxy port (default: 80). Note: proxy details can be set globally in a config file. Requires: [ proxy_host ]

options.name: --proxy-protocol
options.description: Choose the proxy protocol (default: https). Note: proxy details can be set globally in a config file. Requires: [ proxy_host ]

options.name: --disable-optional-telemetry
options.description: Opt-out of sending optional telemetry data. Anonymized telemetry data will remain.

options.name: --debug
options.description: Enable debug mode for detailed output.

github-issue.description: Create a GitHub Issue for any vulnerabilities found using PyUp's remediation data.

github-pr.description: Create a GitHub PR to fix any vulnerabilities using Safety's remediation data.
